intro: Limonium sareptanum, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has silvery-gray foliage and is often found growing in coastal areas and sandy soils. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Limonium sareptanum is also known for its ability to thrive in saline environments.
